---
title: "authentication_excluding_metadata.yml"
---

## High-level description
This YAML configuration file defines authentication settings for a system. It specifies that authentication is required but excludes metadata from the authentication process.

## Symbols

### `authentication`
#### Description
The `authentication` key is the root-level configuration object that contains settings related to the authentication process.

#### Internal Logic
The `authentication` object contains two sub-keys:
1. `required`: Specifies whether authentication is mandatory.
2. `exclude`: Defines exclusion rules for the authentication process.

### `required`
#### Description
A boolean value that determines whether authentication is required for the system.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| required | boolean | Indicates if authentication is mandatory |

### `exclude`
#### Description
An object that specifies exclusion rules for the authentication process.

#### Internal Logic
Currently, it contains one sub-key:
- `metadata`: A boolean value indicating whether metadata should be excluded from authentication.

### `metadata`
#### Description
A boolean value under the `exclude` key that determines whether metadata should be excluded from the authentication process.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| metadata | boolean | Indicates if metadata should be excluded from authentication |

## Configuration
| Option | Type | Default | Description |
|:-------|:-----|:--------|:------------|
| authentication.required | boolean | true | Specifies if authentication is required |
| authentication.exclude.metadata | boolean | true | Indicates if metadata should be excluded from authentication |
